head.title: At a Symposium On Bearing Arms

hedline.hl1: At a Symposium On Bearing Arms

abstract.p: Jonathan P Engel letter on Sept 21 article denies Constitution guarantees unfettered right to own arms

block.p: Those who argue that the Constitution guarantees an individual's right to bear arms (''Dueling Scholars Join Fray Over a Constitutional Challenge to Gun Control Laws,'' news article, Sept. 21) are missing an important point.
Nowhere in the Second Amendment will you find the words ''guns,'' ''rifles'' or ''pistols.'' The word used is ''arms.''

Those who argue that the Constitution guarantees an individual's right to bear arms (''Dueling Scholars Join Fray Over a Constitutional Challenge to Gun Control Laws,'' news article, Sept. 21) are missing an important point.
Nowhere in the Second Amendment will you find the words ''guns,'' ''rifles'' or ''pistols.'' The word used is ''arms.''

Would those who favor the strict constructionist viewpoint claim that individuals have the unfettered right to own ''arms'' like shoulder-fired surface-to-air missiles capable of bringing down an airliner, not to mention nuclear warheads?
Hence, we all agree that some restrictions on the right to bear arms are acceptable and necessary, don't we?
JONATHAN P. ENGEL New York, Sept. 21, 2000
